alert.note: Alert for Gila; Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 21 at 7:05PM MST until March 22 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected across the advisory area. Flood warnings and advisories remain in effect for several waterways in northern Arizona. * WHERE...Portions of central Arizona, including Gila and Yavapai counties. * WHEN...Until 700 AM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Ponding of water on interstates, highways and in urban areas will create hazardous travel conditions. Water flowing over roadways will create slick paved roads and muddy unpaved roads. Ponding of water and flooded low water crossings will be tough to see if you are traveling in the advisory area tonight. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 702 PM MST, rain and snowmelt is occurring, and will cause minor flooding. - This includes many of the creeks, washes and rivers across the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Payson, Camp Verde, Chino Valley, Sedona, Prescott Valley, Prescott, Clarkdale, Dewey-humboldt, Star Valley, Cordes Lakes, Cordes Junction, Spring Valley, Cordes, Childs Power Plant, Bumble Bee, Cherry, Middle Verde, Mayer, Montezuma Castle National Monument and Mcguireville. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
